thread.title: Long Island weather: Snowstorm to leave up to 6 inches
thread.title_full: Long Island weather: Snowstorm to leave up to 6 inches

title: Long Island weather: Snowstorm to leave up to 6 inches
text:
Cops: 2 charged after driver flees officers 
The highest amounts will be on Nassau’s North Shore, he said. About 2 to 5 inches of snow has fallen so far on Long Island, Hoffman said. 
As of 7 a.m., snow was making a changeover as the storm tracked farther west, with more sleet in the mix, said John Murray, weather service meteorologist in Upton. That was being seen at Long Island MacArthur Airport, the weather service’s office in Upton, as well as in Shirley. East Hampton was reporting all rain, with the temperature at 34 degrees. 
A blizzard warning that had been in effect for much of the Island was pulled back to just northern Nassau County and northwestern Suffolk, with a winter storm warning for all other areas, both in effect through midnight.
